articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) scored a victory on Wednesday when a U.S. appeals court paused a government commission's import ban on some of the company's popular Apple smartwatches following a patent dispute with medical-technology firm Masimo (MASI.O).
articles.title: Apple wins bid to pause Apple Watch ban at US appeals court

articles.author: Shubham Batra, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: U.S. stocks edged higher on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 inching closer to its all-time high on prospects of early interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
articles.title: Wall Street rises, S&P close to all-time high

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: The New York Times (NYT.N) sued OpenAI and Microsoft (MSFT.O) on Wednesday, accusing them of using millions of the newspaper's articles without permission to help train chatbots to provide information to readers.
articles.title: New York Times sues OpenAI, Microsoft for infringing copyrighted works

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark's Maersk (MAERSKb.CO) said on Wednesday it has scheduled several dozen container vessels to travel via the Suez Canal and the Red Sea in the next several weeks, in a further sign that global shipping firms are returning to the route.
articles.title: Maersk schedules dozens of vessels to travel via Suez Canal

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Axon CEO Rick Smith says the Taser was inspired by the shooting deaths of two school friends. It's largely a tall tale, part of a pattern at Axon, Reuters found.
articles.title: Taser maker Axon has a moving backstory. It's mostly a myth

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Explosions in the Red Sea off the coast of Yemen were reported on Tuesday after sightings of unmanned aircraft and missiles in two separate incidents, a British maritime authority said.
articles.title: Explosions reported in Red Sea shipping lane off Yemen coast

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Donald Trump scored a victory on Wednesday in his fight against challenges to his eligibility to run for the White House again when Michigan's top court declined to hear a case seeking to disqualify him from the state's presidential primary ballot.
articles.title: Trump wins Michigan state court battle to qualify for primary election ballot

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Supreme Court has upheld a decision to bar a former TV journalist who opposes the war in Ukraine from taking part in a presidential election in March, Yekaterina Duntsova, the would-be candidate, said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Anti-war candidate says top Russian court backs barring her from challenging Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British finance minister Jeremy Hunt will present the spring budget on March 6, in what is likely to be the government's last major chance to prepare the ground for an election that must be held by January 2025.
articles.title: UK's Hunt to deliver budget on March 6 as election looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A large crowd of Indonesian students stormed a convention centre housing hundreds of Rohingya refugees from Myanmar in the city of Banda Aceh on Wednesday, demanding they be deported, Reuters footage showed.
articles.title: Indonesian protesters storm refugee shelter calling for deportation of Rohingya
